> <OLD>
>
> WHEELIE was not particularly well versed over in the intricacies of Predacon
> and Maximal politics, but even he had heard a glistening of the dread
> MAGMATRON.

<NEW>

Yes, the dreaded MAGMATRON, there were many whispering of who and what
he was. he was once a decorated Warrior-General who rose up within the
ranks of the Predacons, powerful and intelligent he was a military and
tactical genius. He disappeared almost a century ago. Some thought he
had been defeated in some battle, perhaps assasinated by an up and
comming Predacon. But yet here he was finally resurfacing after five
decades here on old Earth.

> <OLD>
>
> Walking along with the three, he nodded, "Perhaps, that is the way I shall
> go.  As they say, the more I shall know."
>
> Walking along< "And I am sorry you came from Magmatron.  He is a terror that
> let much on.  I must apologize for what he made you this day, I am thankful
> you were able to get away."
>
> Walking along wtih them towards the mysterious unit that they had mentioned
> who had told of thier origins, and watching around quietly.  The presence of
> Magmatron and the unit he had not heard of desginate Saberback would be
> filed away in his processor, as soon as he was out of this strange null zone
> of communications to be broadcast back to the Maximal command staff present.

<NEW>

There was a nod from UNUS, "It is not your fault." he said solemly.
"But that which does not terminate us only gives us strength." There
was a quiet dignity in him as he moved. For some reason, even though
he was the same body design and structure as the rest he was larger
and robust, his armor a bit thicker from the look of it. His movements
were one of a soldier, long used to the art of war, much like the
others who walked with them.

"We have not learned much from your friend." FIREHORN said as they
walked, his words more gruff and clipped. "But he seemed to be be made
of sturdy material. "He came in heavilly wounded and yet he was still
able to talk, even if just a little."

ASTRA nodded, "It was Firehorn who found him." She said. "We brought him here."

They stopped at a door with medical syumbology recognizable on it. At
UNUS' gesture the door slid open.

Inside was a very spartan room. The walls were plain and ulitarian,
painted a single offwhite color. There was a small console on one side
presumably for the medical staff to use. There was a small viewscreen,
a single recharging chamber and medical bed.

However on the bed was a single figure, his optics dull but definitely
online as he focused on WHEELIE. "I thought it would be Tuscon coming
for me." he said groggilly as if he had just come out of a long sleep.
"But I am glad it is you." His voice clearing as he spoke.

He sat up on the medbed, painted in oranges, reds and golds he was the
picture of leadership and yet even when recovering there was still a
power within him, an energy or fire that could not wholly quenched.

It was RODIMUS PRIME.

(TAG)

Preston
